summary: This is a letter from attorney Roy Black to Assistant U.S. Attorney Jeffrey Sloman, notifying the U.S. Attorney's Office about Jeffrey Epstein's request to transfer his community control supervision from Florida to the U.S. Virgin Islands. The letter asserts Epstein's compliance with his plea agreements and seeks to avoid any inadvertent violations.

events.title: Letter Regarding Supervision Transfer Request
events.description: Roy Black sends a letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office notifying them of Jeffrey Epstein's request to transfer his community control supervision from Florida to the U.S. Virgin Islands.

events.title: Epstein Completes Incarceration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has finished the incarceration portion of his sentence and is serving one year of community control.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had finished his incarceration and was serving a one-year community control sentence as of September 2009.
Epstein was requesting to transfer his community control supervision from Florida to the U.S. Virgin Islands via the Intrastate Compact for Transfer of Adult Supervision (ICAOS).
Epstein's legal team asserted that the transfer request was in full compliance with both his state plea agreement and the federal non-prosecution agreement.
The letter demonstrates ongoing legal oversight and communication between Epstein's defense and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the terms of his sentence.
Epstein was reportedly still residing at his home in Palm Beach and following the rules of community control while the transfer was being processed.
